1123299812483321856.text: 10/ If you want to find out more about what we are going to do in detail check out http://golden.com/blog/introducing-golden …, also don’t forget to follow @golden to keep posted on our updates and give editing a shot by signing up here http://golden.com/signup

1123299811627716608.text: 9/ We would love help from the community to build this knowledge base - feel free to add neutral, 3rd person descriptions of your companies/projects or general topics.

1123299810516193280.text: 8/ In order to make money while doing this we have released an advanced query tool to query the Golden data set, provide fine-grained alerts and allow companies to figure out how to make decisions. http://golden.com/enterprise  & check out an example output here http://golden.com/y-combinator-w19-companies/ …

1123299809606098945.text: 7/ Here are some examples of interesting pages built on Golden http://golden.com/wiki/Cluster%3A_Blockchain_%26_cryptocurrency … http://golden.com/wiki/Momentus_Space … http://golden.com/wiki/Cluster%3A_Synthetic_biology … http://golden.com/wiki/Geltor  http://golden.com/wiki/Algorand http://golden.com/wiki/Morphogenetic_Engineering …

1123299808813256705.text: 6/ Additionally we are keen to explore using AI to give feedback on editor contributions (sentiment, style, grammar/spelling, tense etc) but also claim validation down the road. We are starting in the scientific, industrial and commercial areas of information first.

1123299807907307520.text: 5/ Check out our AI suggestions here http://golden.com/suggestions  and our AI assisted editor. We have not exposed all types of suggestions yet.

1123299807051665408.text: 4/ We have set out to use various techniques to help bring leverage and automate solving the problem including: topic prediction, taxonomic detection, summarization, event detection, cross linking, structure data detection and ultimately the writing of prose using AI.

1123299806133100545.text: 3/ In order to help achieve the mission we raised $5m from @a16z @pmarca Gigafund (Luke + @oskoui), @foundersfund @cyantist @svangel @JoeMontana @__aston__ @jellyfishbloom @immad @joshbuckley @howietl, @loopj @JamesTamplin @_jacksmith @michaeleinziger @sharpshoot @tripadler ++

1123299805243928576.text: 2/ Golden’s mission is to collect, organize and express 10+ billion topics in an accessible way, presented in neutrally-written and comprehensive topic pages using AI and UI to automate the process where possible.

1123299804346322944.text:
1/ My team and I at Golden have been working diligently for the last two years to map out 10bn+ fascinating topics in high detail. Today we are officially launching, announcing a $5m seed round from @a16z @foundersfund, GigaFund and others

http://golden.com/blog/introducing-golden … thread below ->

1113505938114134016.text: For anyone wanting to know which non stealth companies were in the latest YC batch, we compiled on Golden a full list of Y Combinator W19 batch  https://golden.com/y-combinator-w19-companies/ … if we have any mistakes please edit the page/data. Some very interesting companies in the batch.

1113454571022454786.text: Our mission always has been -- and always will be -- to back the best tech entrepreneurs, at all stages. 3/3

1113454461119160321.text: We cannot advise you on what to invest in! But we will continue to evolve how we run our business and innovate in supporting the startup ecosystem. 2/3

1113454379741224961.text: Our firm (@a16z) has filed an application to register as an investment adviser (still pending). But that doesn’t mean our jobs change. We are and will remain a VC firm. 1/3

1015703372802895872.text: "A record-low of U.S. workers earned poverty-level wages last year, and that share is likely to fall further." https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-07-03/fewest-americans-earning-poverty-level-wages …pic.twitter.com/tuHDHAXYpH

1015708144465571840.text: "Authors did not start declaring communism dead until just before its actual demise in 1989. Liberalism, by contrast, has been pronounced dead for at least the past 150 years, though it has not yet actually died."https://aeon.co/essays/reports-of-the-demise-of-liberalism-are-greatly-exaggerated …

1015707686594179072.text: "According to this analysis, liberalism first died in the late 1870s, then died some more at the turn of the 20th century, and has been dying almost continuously since 1920."https://aeon.co/essays/reports-of-the-demise-of-liberalism-are-greatly-exaggerated …

1015706922538987520.text: "The prediction of liberalism’s imminent demise is hardly a new story. Scholars and statesmen have been declaring liberalism dead or in deep crisis for at least a century and a half."https://aeon.co/essays/reports-of-the-demise-of-liberalism-are-greatly-exaggerated …

1015706333771788288.text: "Critics agree that liberalism can no longer solve our deep social, cultural, political and economic problems, and that it has become ‘unsustainable’. Not coincidentally, all of these critics are living, writing and publishing in liberal countries."https://aeon.co/essays/reports-of-the-demise-of-liberalism-are-greatly-exaggerated …

1015699669823811584.text: "When moderates acquiesce to partisans, they signal to the opposition ideological inflexibility and unwillingness to come together. Moderates on either side may agree with one another. But similarities are never discovered and compromises are never made."https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015698891478466560.text: "Preference falsification artificially inflates political polarization. If our political preferences have been falsified, then our differences might not be as pronounced or as authentic as we think them to be."https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015698548120145920.text: "Less opinionated entrants falsify their preferences to not upset those who decide the rules, rewards, and punishments. Moderates will often support fringe positions for the sake of group solidarity and reputational preservation."https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015698144477114368.text: "How do moderates navigate this complex web of political tribes and echo chambers? Simply put, they falsify their preferences. Most moderates conform to group preferences that have been established by committed ideologues."https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015697543194267648.text: "Moderates are more likely to move toward the extremes than partisans are to move toward the middle. Given their flexibility, moderates tend to adopt the preferences of the intransigent minority."https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015697331994292224.text: "We falsify our preferences to maintain or improve our standing within a group. Conformity to group preferences yields approval, affection, and advancement within the group. The punishment for nonconformity is disrespect and ostracism."https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015697185143287808.text: "One of the most important concepts for understanding social behavior is preference falsification -- when an individual publicly misrepresents their private views to fit into a social group. It is conformity for the sake of social self-interest."https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015696769055797249.text: "Most Americans are not impassioned ideologues, neither coopted by Soros nor swayed by Koch. According to a May 2018 Gallup poll, 43% of Americans considered themselves “Independents” while 26% and 29% considered themselves “Republicans” and “Democrats.”"https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015696570807828480.text: "Do most people legitimately disagree with one another? Or are they merely conforming to supposedly dominant ideas?  We contend that modern American political tribalism has been artificially inflated by group-based conformity."https://quillette.com/2018/07/02/political-moderates-are-lying/ …

1015677253202481153.text: "Persons in authority have had to jump through hoops of fire to achieve their lofty posts -- and feel disinclined to pay attention to anyone who has not."pic.twitter.com/v4G47eIMDd

1015675173263925248.text: "Two modes of being, old and new, hierarchical and networked, industrial and egalitarian, top down and bottom up, seem unable to achieve a resolution, a victory of any sort."pic.twitter.com/7YQCEeQwib

1015672283891765248.text: "The docile mass audience, so easily persuaded by advertisers and politicians, had been a monopolist's fantasy which disintegrated at first contact with alternatives."pic.twitter.com/NZZj90pQx8

1015670712680398849.text: "Public discussion was limited to a very few topics of interest to the articulate elites."pic.twitter.com/Ue7ZMlXMNo

1015668133472813056.text: "Back when the world and I were young, information was scarce, hence valuable... A curious thing happens to sources of information under conditions of scarcity. They become authoritative."pic.twitter.com/RFk2ss2s9s

1015665031474606081.text: Thread: Reading The Revolt Of The Public And The Crisis Of Authority In The New Millennium by @mgurri --> https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00KQMVOPM/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_gDqqBbB3HY4GB …

1015385258760392705.text: Extreme Ownership: How U.S. Navy SEALs Lead and Win by @jockowillink -- I hand out more copies of this book than any other. How to take responsibility for yourself and for those around you. Modern Stoicism, as applied in the military, business, and life.https://www.amazon.com/Extreme-Ownership-U-S-Navy-SEALs-ebook/dp/B00VE4Y0Z2 …

1015384681120858113.text: Triumph of the City: How Our Greatest Invention Makes Us Richer, Smarter, Greener, Healthier, and Happier by Edward Glaeser -- How cities drive the development of civilization, by putting people together. Highly relevant to the future of the Internet!https://www.amazon.com/Triumph-City-Greatest-Invention-Healthier/dp/0143120549 …

1015384189980459008.text: The Rational Optimist: How Prosperity Evolves by @mattwridley -- Sparkling explanation of how the economy evolves, producing the glorious cornucopia of goods and services available all around us. How to feel good about the future even in dark times.https://www.amazon.com/Rational-Optimist-Prosperity-Evolves-P-s/dp/0061452068 …

1015383458850353157.text: A Spy Among Friends: Kim Philby and the Great Betrayal by @BenMacintyre1 -- True, chilling saga of straight up, profoundly deep treason and betrayal. Sociopaths in high positions of power and influence. Hair curling.https://www.amazon.com/Spy-Among-Friends-Philby-Betrayal/dp/0804136653 …

1015083308655362051.text: How to Live: A Life of Montaigne in One Question and Twenty Attempts at an Answer by @Sarah_Bakewell -- "How to get along with people, how to deal with violence, how to adjust to losing someone you love—All versions of a bigger question: How do you live?"https://www.amazon.com/How-Live-Montaigne-Question-Attempts/dp/1590514831/ref=sr_1_3?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530849583&sr=1-3&keywords=how+to+live …

1015082703094362112.text: Lone Survivor: The Eyewitness Account of Operation Redwing and the Lost Heroes of SEAL Team 10 by @MarcusLuttrell -- The film was fine but the book is unreal; incredibly vivid story of superlative American heroes. https://www.amazon.com/Lone-Survivor-Eyewitness-Account-Operation/dp/031632406X/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530849435&sr=1-1&keywords=lone+survivor …

1015081953610031104.text: A Very Expensive Poison: The Assassination of Alexander Litvinenko by @lukeharding1968 -- The astonishing story of the Litvinenko and Perepilichnyy assassinations in the UK; reads like a Lee Child thriller; plenty topical now.https://www.amazon.com/Very-Expensive-Poison-Assassination-Litvinenko/dp/1101973994/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530849150&sr=1-1&keywords=a+very+expensive+poison …

1015078090035228672.text: The Myth of the Rational Voter by @bryan_caplan -- "The median American is a moderate national socialist – statist to the core on both economic and social policy.  Given public opinion, the policies of First World democracies are surprisingly libertarian." https://www.amazon.com/Myth-Rational-Voter-Democracies-Policies/dp/0691138737/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530848409&sr=1-1&keywords=myth+of+the+rational+voter …

1015075384419741696.text: Living with a SEAL: 31 Days Training with the Toughest Man on the Planet by @the100MileMan -- What's it like to train with a Navy SEAL in winter in New York for a whole month? Featuring the truly remarkable American hero @davidgoggins.https://www.amazon.com/Living-SEAL-Training-Toughest-Planet/dp/1455534684/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530847679&sr=1-1&keywords=living+with+a+seal …

1015074655252541440.text: Shattered: Inside Hillary Clinton's Doomed Campaign by @jonallendc & @amieparnes -- Best (?) book so far on the Democratic side of the 2016 race, most provocatively on the impact of the press coverage of the email hacks on the last stages of the race.https://www.amazon.com/Shattered-Inside-Hillary-Clintons-Campaign/dp/0553447084/ref=sr_1_4?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530847508&sr=1-4&keywords=shattered …

1015073800000397312.text: Devil's Bargain: Steve Bannon, Donald Trump, and the Storming of the Presidency by @JoshuaGreen -- Best (?) book so far on the Republican side of the 2016 race, and a deep dive into the intellectual origins of Bannonism and to some extent Trumpism. https://www.amazon.com/Devils-Bargain-Bannon-Storming-Presidency/dp/0735225028/ref=sr_1_4?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530847296&sr=1-4&keywords=steve+bannon …

1015072051348979714.text: The Rise of Superman: Decoding the Science of Ultimate Human Performance by @steven_kotler -- Startling walk through a series of domains where peak human performance is rising at remarkable rates due to "flow state". Thought provoking and then some.https://www.amazon.com/Rise-Superman-Decoding-Ultimate-Performance-ebook/dp/B00BW54XVO/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530846767&sr=1-1&keywords=rise+of+superman …

1015070732215152640.text: Civilian Warriors: The Inside Story of Blackwater by Erik Prince -- The founding and growth of military contractor Blackwater as told by its founder and CEO; newly relevant due to the Mueller investigation. https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/special-counsel-obtains-trump-ally-erik-princes-phones/story?id=56143477 …https://www.amazon.com/Civilian-Warriors-Inside-Blackwater-Unsung/dp/1591847451/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530846587&sr=1-1&keywords=erik+prince …

1015027834383826944.text: Days of Rage: America's Radical Underground, the FBI, and the Forgotten Age of Revolutionary Violence by @BryanBurrough -- How 1960s racial politics descended into 1970s terrorist bombings, thanks to privileged college students breaking very bad.https://www.amazon.com/Days-Rage-Underground-Forgotten-Revolutionary/dp/0143107976/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530836319&sr=1-1&keywords=days+of+rage …

1015011381362323456.text: Hacks: The Inside Story of the Break-ins and Breakdowns That Put Donald Trump in the White House by @donnabrazile -- Visceral, raw, you-are-there recounting of living through the hack attacks and resulting meltdown of the DNC in 2016.https://www.amazon.com/Hacks-Inside-Break-ins-Breakdowns-Donald/dp/0316478512/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530832388&sr=1-1&keywords=hacks …

1015010037318672384.text: Slugfest: Inside the Epic, 50-year Battle between Marvel and DC by @reed_tucker -- Spellbinding creative and business history of the incredibly imaginative comic book industry in the decades before it ate Hollywood.https://www.amazon.com/Slugfest-Inside-50-year-Battle-between/dp/0306825465/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530831980&sr=1-1&keywords=slugfest …

1015008742792835072.text: 12 Rules for Life: An Antidote to Chaos by @jordanbpeterson -- A bracing disassembly and reconstruction of a theory of individual progress in the modern world. Fascinating compare and contrast with The Courage To Be Disliked https://twitter.com/pmarca/status/1014995198672187392 …. https://www.amazon.com/12-Rules-Life-Antidote-Chaos/dp/0345816021/ref=sr_1_3?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530831709&sr=1-3&keywords=jordan+peterson …

1015006783394344961.text: Skin in the Game by @nntaleb -- Skin in the game as conflict of interest, or as attaching one's livelihood to one's speech? Who to listen to, and why. Ideal counterpart to @PTetlock's Expert Political Judgment https://twitter.com/pmarca/status/1014989022249115648 …. https://www.amazon.com/Skin-Game-Hidden-Asymmetries-Daily/dp/042528462X/ref=sr_1_4?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530831274&sr=1-4&keywords=skin+in+the+game …

1015005906575036417.text: Conspiracy: Peter Thiel, Hulk Hogan, Gawker, and the Anatomy of Intrigue by @RyanHoliday -- Startlingly deep cultural history of conspiracies, examined through the lens of the brutally effective Gawker takedown, with full access to the main players. https://www.amazon.com/Conspiracy-Peter-Gawker-Anatomy-Intrigue/dp/0735217645/ref=sr_1_1_sspa?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530831116&sr=1-1-spons&keywords=conspiracy&psc=1 …

1015005247092113408.text: A Higher Loyalty: Truth, Lies, and Leadership by @Comey -- Certainly the story is well known, but given author's propensity to post photos of himself wearing running shoes in Iowa, potentially relevant again starting next year? https://www.amazon.com/Higher-Loyalty-Truth-Lies-Leadership/dp/1250192455/ref=sr_1_3?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530830865&sr=1-3&keywords=a+higher+loyalty …pic.twitter.com/g7PCGax4Hh

1015003943024263168.text: The Strange Death of Europe by @DouglasKMurray -- One perspective on the politics of immgiration in Europe, playing out in real time, e.g. Merkel almost getting deposed days ago. Confusing on multiple levels from US perspective. https://www.amazon.com/Strange-Death-Europe-Immigration-Identity/dp/1472958055/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530829914&sr=1-1&keywords=strange+death+of+europe …

1015000269254377472.text: Chasing Hillary: Ten Years, Two Presidential Campaigns, and One Intact Glass Ceiling by @amychozick -- On the bus/in the plane with the Hillary campaign. Revealing in many dimensions at once, and highly entertaining. Best book on the 2016 campaign so far?https://www.amazon.com/Chasing-Hillary-Presidential-Campaigns-Ceiling/dp/0062413597/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530829798&sr=1-1&keywords=chasing+hillary …

1014998575103729664.text: But What If We're Wrong?: Thinking About the Present As If It Were the Past by @CKlosterman -- Wide-ranging meditation on how to think about the reality that we're probably wrong about most things we believe. Hard to read and not emerge humbled.https://www.amazon.com/But-What-If-Were-Wrong/dp/0399184139/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530829390&sr=1-1&keywords=but+what+if+we%27re+wrong …

1014997988383420416.text: When the Wolves Bite: Two Billionaires, One Company, and an Epic Wall Street Battle by @ScottWapnerCNBC -- "Wall Street"-esque battle between Bill Ackman and Carl Icahn over unlikely target Herbalife. Sip a delicious Herbal Aloe Shake while reading. https://www.amazon.com/When-Wolves-Bite-Billionaires-Company/dp/1610398270/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530828860&sr=1-1&keywords=when+the+wolves+bite …

1014995856569741313.text: All Out War: The Full Story of How Brexit Sank Britain's Political Class by @ShippersUnbound -- Inside story of how Britain decided to exit the EU. Economic self-destruction or national liberation? Repercussions to play out for decades.https://www.amazon.com/All-Out-War-Britains-Political/dp/0008215154 …

1014995198672187392.text: The Courage to Be Disliked by Ichiro Kishimi & Fumitake Koga -- Smash hit in Japan, and easy to see why. Adlerian psychology meets Stoic philosophy in Socratic dialogue. Compelling from front to back. Highly recommend.https://www.amazon.com/Courage-Be-Disliked-Phenomenon-Happiness/dp/1501197274/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530828519&sr=1-1&keywords=courage+to+be+disliked …

1014993682527805440.text: A Guide to the Good Life: The Ancient Art of Stoic Joy by William B. Irvine -- Best (?) walk through the ancient/current philosophy of Stoicism. You can't control other people but you can control yourself, so do that. https://www.amazon.com/Guide-Good-Life-Ancient-Stoic/dp/0195374614/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530828113&sr=1-1&keywords=a+guide+to+the+good+life …

1014992693959655425.text: The Spider Network by @davidenrich -- "Billions"-esque saga of global financial market manipulation, at mind-boggling scale and hiding in plain sight, by a small cabal of bankers in London.https://www.amazon.com/Spider-Network-Scheming-Bankers-Greatest/dp/0062452991/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530827811&sr=1-1&keywords=spider+network …

1014991295025012736.text: Thinking in Bets by @AnnieDuke -- Compact guide to probabilistic domains like poker, or venture capital. Best articulation of "resulting", drawing bad conclusions from confusing process and outcome. Recommend for people operating in the real world.https://www.amazon.com/Thinking-Bets-Making-Smarter-Decisions/dp/0735216355/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1530827598&sr=1-1&keywords=thinking+in+bets …

1014990390288498688.text: Thinking, Fast and Slow by Daniel Kahneman -- Captivating dive into human decision making, marred by inclusion of several/many? psychology studies that fail to replicate. Will stand as a cautionary tale? https://twitter.com/degenrolf/status/832484413602553856?lang=en … https://www.amazon.com/Thinking-Fast-Slow-Daniel-Kahneman/dp/0374533555 …

1014989022249115648.text: Expert Political Judgment: How Good Is It? How Can We Know? by @PTetlock -- Is the future knowable, and by whom? All pundits and commentators should publish their prediction track records, yet don't. What to pay attention to and what to ignore.https://www.amazon.com/Expert-Political-Judgment-Good-Know/dp/0691128715 …

1014987920304832512.text: Thread: Books I've recently read and recommend -->
